subject: p18067737
Findings: Study is limited as the left costophrenic angle is excluded from the field-of-view. Left-sided dual-chamber pacemaker with leads terminating in the right atrium and right ventricle is unchanged. Again noted is a left upper lobe paramediastinal mass. Opacification in the left lung base likely reflects a combination of a moderate-to-large pleural effusion and adjacent atelectasis. The right lung is grossly clear. There is no pulmonary vascular congestion.
Impression: No significant interval change from the prior exam. No evidence of congestive heart failure. Persistent left pleural effusion and left basilar opacity likely reflective of atelectasis. Left upper lobe paramediastinal mass compatible with known malignancy.
